Summary: small white dot travelling strait line east to west rather quickly
divs: Sighting DetailsI was running in the country southwest of Edmonton and noticed a white dot in the southern sky travelling at a good clip east to west. It has no discernible lines or features. Was not a helicopter. Was not an aircraft with wings and fuselage. Just a quick moving "dot". I watched it as it went into clouds and out and it changed tone to darker because of the shadow effect of clouds. The duration was about 1- 2 minutes until it disappeared in the western sky. I estimate it was travelling at sub-sonic speed but quickly. I had plenty of time to realize there were no features describing a helicopter or aircraft. There is an international airport south of Edmonton however, as I said, it had no features of an aircraft. It probably was, but I have seen countless many aircraft in the distance in the skies and under many circumstances and they all are obviously planes or helicopters.
trends: There have been 70 other sightings in Edmonton
There were no other sightings in Edmonton on or around August 4th 2002
